content:
Jhansi is trying to attract investments in various industries to boost the city's economic growth. One such industry is the logistics sector, which is one of the primary industries in Jhansi. The city is strategically located at the junction of two major national highways and is connected to major ports and industrial hubs in the country through rail and road networks. Therefore, the city has the potential to become a hub for logistics and warehousing. The government of Uttar Pradesh has also announced plans to develop a freight corridor that would pass through Jhansi, making it an even more attractive destination for logistics companies.

Apart from logistics, Jhansi is also looking to attract investments in the tourism sector. The city has a rich historical and cultural heritage, and there are various historical sites, such as the Jhansi Fort and Rani Mahal, that attract tourists from around the country. The local government is also promoting adventure tourism by promoting the rock-climbing sites in the area.

Lastly, the city is also promoting small and medium enterprises (SMEs) in various sectors such as food processing, textiles, and handicrafts. By fostering the growth of SMEs, the city aims to provide employment opportunities to the local population and spur economic growth.
